page.title: 16Rehaghy House
page.content: {Rehaghy House}is about Two and a half miles outside the town of Aughnacloy on the Benburb road. It is owned at the moment by two businessmen who live in Holland. Mr Robert Morrow looks after the hotel for them. Rehaghy House was used in the{Second {World War}by the{Royal Air Force. }Mr Caddoo, the former owner, bought it from the{Maine Family}and sold it to the Dutch businessmen. The house is very old and the rooms in it are very big. There are also servant's rooms at the back of the house. Outside the house there are a lot of birds and there is also a large goldfish in a pond. Beside this a byre has been converted into a horse drawn coach house Mr Morrow Has painted pictures on the walls. Today the house is used as a hotel where people can go for a meal
